perturbation.original_text: Kiromic is committed to bear all costs necessary for R&D, including all clinical development costs, according to the terms and conditions set out in point n. 3;
perturbation.changed_text: Kiromic may, at its sole discretion, bear costs associated with R&D, potentially including clinical development costs, subject to budget availability.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces uncertainty regarding Kiromic's financial commitment. The original text states a clear obligation, while the modified version makes it discretionary and dependent on budget, creating a contradiction and potential for disputes.
perturbation.location: Topic 1. Clinical trial program in Oncology.

perturbation.original_text: Withdrawal or termination by mutual consent shall only have effect for the future and shall not affect the part of the Agreement already executed.
perturbation.changed_text: Withdrawal or termination by mutual consent may retroactively nullify aspects of the Agreement already executed, subject to further negotiation between the Parties.
perturbation.explanation: This creates a contradiction by suggesting that previously completed aspects of the agreement might be affected by withdrawal, contradicting the original clause that protected executed parts. This weakens the assurance and creates ambiguity around completed obligations.

perturbation.original_text: All disputes arising out of or in connection with this Agreement shall be finally settled under the Rules of Arbitration of the International Chamber of Commerce by one or more arbitrators appointed in accordance with the said Rules. Any such arbitration shall (i) be subject to the application of the Italian Law, (ii) take place in Paris, France and (iii) be conducted in English.
perturbation.changed_text: All disputes arising out of or in connection with this Agreement may be subject to mediation prior to any form of binding arbitration. The governing law for the mediation process shall be determined by the mediator.
perturbation.explanation: This change directly contradicts the agreement to final and binding arbitration under ICC rules. It introduces a *possibility* of mediation with a choice of law left to the mediator, undermining the original arbitration clause and the certainty it provided about dispute resolution mechanisms.
